p: Some of the most notable plants employed against respiratory problems include Artemisia vulgaris ( Khan and Gilani 2009), Boerhavia procumbens ( Bokhari and Khan 2015), Capparis spinosa L. ( Trombetta et al., 2005), Carum copticum ( Gilani et al., 2005), Cistanche tubulosa ( Yamada et al., 2010), Euphorbia hirta ( Youssouf et al., 2007), Hyoscyamus niger ( Gilani et al., 2008), and Zingiber officinalis ( Naik et al., 2013). Apart from these, there are hundreds of plants used for their activity in treating or reducing the symptoms of respiratory problems such as cough, asthma, cold, bronchitis, flu, respiratory tract infections, whopping cough and breathing problems ( Table 1 ). Among the medicinal plants, herbs are mostly used in respiratory problems in the form of decoction, powder, juice, tea or oil ( Alamgeer et al., 2018).
